importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating the timing of the news about Doug Martin's death and the ongoing public response.
The date of Doug Martin’s selection in the 2012 NFL draft, highlighting a key milestone in his professional career.
The year Martin achieved first-team All-Pro status and Pro Bowl selection, marking a peak in his performance during his NFL career.
The date Martin was arrested, which coincides with the incident leading to his death; a pivotal moment in the timeline of the event.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which Doug Martin played in the NFL, including his rise to prominence and peak performance, illustrating his career trajectory and impact.

keyTakeAways: Former NFL running back Doug Martin died after a struggle with police during an arrest for suspected involvement in a break-in at a home in Oakland.
Martin was 36 years old at the time of his death and had a distinguished career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, including being a first-round draft pick in 2012.
He was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history and earned multiple Pro Bowl and All-Pro honors.
Martin had a career total of 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, with additional receiving statistics.
The Oakland Police Department confirmed a 'brief struggle' during the arrest, but did not release further details.
An autopsy was conducted to determine the cause of death, which has not yet been made public.
Martin’s family requested privacy during their grief, and officials from Oakland and the Buccaneers expressed condolences.
The incident raises broader concerns about police conduct, use of force, and safety of individuals during arrests, especially those with criminal or financial histories.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, a former Tampa Bay Buccaneers star and one of the franchise's top 50 players, died at age 36 after a brief struggle with Oakland Police Department officers during an arrest for a suspected home break-in. The incident occurred on Saturday, October 6, 2025, and he was transported to a hospital where he later passed away. While the police confirmed a struggle, they did not release further details. The cause of death remains under investigation through an autopsy conducted by the Alameda County Coroner’s Office. Martin’s family has requested privacy, and officials from both the city and the Buccaneers have expressed condolences. The incident has sparked public concern about police conduct and the safety of individuals during detentions, especially those with past legal or financial entanglements.
title: Former NFL player Doug Martin died after struggling with officers while being detained
